page.title: 11HOUSING IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON}has very few houses. None of them is less than twenty years old. Most of them were built by the Turnor family for either farm managers, farm-workers or their own family such as the dower house now called Warren House. Most houses are owner-occupied. There are six empty houses in{PANTON these are three pairs of farm cottages They are in a habitable condition but it is unlikely that they will be lived in as they still belong respectively to Warren House Farm and{PANTON}House farm who will not require them for farmworkers and it is unlikely that if they came up for sale that anyone would be interested in buying them because of employment problems in the area. Ironically there is a nationwide housing problem. One pair of farm cottages -next to Skew Bridge has been converted to one single house.
